Description: Lower body sherd of Chian Mature Animal Style or Grand Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with two bands in added white; exterior: part of three brown bands.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by University of Pennsylvania Museum of Archaeology and Anthropology, Philadelphia. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
The number '15' is written in pencil on the exterior surface. The exterior decoration is consisten with both the Animal Chalice and Grand Styles.
Bibliographic references: CVA Philadelphia II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Fasc. 29, The University Museum Philadelphia II (p. 17, pl. 5, 2d)
Lemos 1991 / Archaic Pottery of Chios. The Decorated Styles (p. 303, no. 1123, pl. 154)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0669) (phase 2)
